title: Cardinals make McBride NFL's highest-paid TE
content: The Cardinals are making Pro Bowler Trey McBride the highest-paid tight end in NFL history, his agents told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Thursday.

title: Source: Raiders, QB Smith reach $75M extension
content: The Raiders have agreed to a two-year, $75 million extension with quarterback Geno Smith, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: UConn adds ex-Georgia star Demary to backcourt
content: Georgia transfer Silas Demary Jr. committed to UConn, the school announced Thursday, giving the Huskies one of the best guards in the transfer portal and a much-needed boost to their backcourt.

title: S.C. on Final Four opponents: 'We owe them one'
content: South Carolina's three losses this season came against the other three teams in the Final Four -- Texas, UCLA and UConn.

title: Auburn star Broome: 'No limitations' with elbow
content: Four days after he suffered an elbow injury in Auburn's Elite Eight win over Michigan State, Johni Broome said he'll be ready to go with "no limitations" Saturday for the Final Four.

title: Sources: Morant, Hield warned over finger guns
content: Grizzlies guard Ja Morant and Warriors guard Buddy Hield were both issued warnings for mimicking shooting a gun during Tuesday's game, sources told ESPN

title: Backup plan: Cowboys trade for Pats QB Milton
content: The Patriots traded quarterback Joe Milton III and a seventh-round pick to the Cowboys for a fifth-round pick Thursday as Dallas sought a backup option.

title: Baltimore sues sportsbooks over 'shady' practices
content: The city of Baltimore sued DraftKings and the parent company of FanDuel, accusing them of using deceptive and unfair practices to target and exploit vulnerable gamblers.

title: Are torpedo bats legal? Here's how they work and facts to know
content: A new baseball bat is all the rage right now. It's time to get up to speed on the MLB season's newest craze.

title: Your guide to the men's Final Four: Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston (with picks!)
content: Here's how each team can win Saturday's semifinals, plus their potential flaws and predictions for both games.

title: Bilas: Why this men's Final Four will be 'absolutely incredible'
content: No low seeds? No problem. We get to watch four of the most efficient teams of all time -- and that's a good thing.

title: Safety? Aesthetics? Competitive advantage? The real reasons why some teams want to ban the tush push
content: It wasn't just about a polarizing on-field rule. It was a window into the back-channel politics of the rules process.

title: Tatum? Pippen? NBA execs share best comps for projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg
content: Ahead of the Final Four, NBA execs share their comparisons for the Duke star and projected No. 1 draft pick.

title: Is it time for South Carolina to panic? Three keys for the Gamecocks in the women's Final Four
content: South Carolina had to rally (twice) to reach the Final Four. Can the reigning champs still run it back?

title: 'In what world does that make sense?' MLB players weigh in on our top 100
content: We asked players from around baseball for their feedback on our MLB Rank list -- and once niceties were set aside, we found out how they really felt.

title: First impressions from the Athletics' new home opener
content: How the players, fans and staff handled the first of many games in their minor league stadium residency.

title: Ranking the best running backs in college football for 2025
content: From a CFP standout and a pair of teammates to two impact freshmen, here are our picks for the top 10 RBs.

title: Who will emerge from the Eastern wild-card chaos?
content: The Canadiens and Blue Jackets both take the ice Thursday. Here are matchup details, full bracket projections.

title: Why Ovechkin is 'nearly impossible' to stop: Opponents, teammates explain his shot
content: Top NHL blueliners, goalies and scorers explain Ovi's unique skill as he closes in on Wayne Gretzky's record.

title: UEFA boss: 64-team men's World Cup 'a bad idea'
content: A push to expand the men's 2030 World Cup to 64 teams is "a bad idea," UEFA president Aleksander Čeferin said on Thursday.

title: U.S. to get '31 Women's World Cup; U.K. in '35
content: Gianni Infantino said the United States and the United Kingdom are poised to be named as hosts of the Women's World Cup in 2031 and 2035, respectively.

title: Barça win appeal, Olmo, Víctor cleared to play
content: Spain's sports ministry (CSD) have ruled that Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor can continue to play for Barcelona until the end of the season.

title: Arsenal CB Gabriel's season over, surgery due
content: Arsenal defender Gabriel Magalhaes requires surgery on his hamstring injury and will miss the rest of the season as a result.

title: PGMOL: Tarkowski deserved red against Liverpool
content: PGMOL has admitted that Everton defender James Tarkowski should have been sent off through a VAR review in the Merseyside derby on Wednesday night.

title: Miami coach on ref call: A red here or on the moon
content: Javier Mascherano questioned the decision to not send off Nathan Ordaz, saying it would have prompted a red card "here and in China and the moon."

title: Mourinho grabs manager's nose after cup defeat
content: Fenerbahce manager Jose Mourinho was involved in a bizarre altercation with Galatasaray boss Okan Buruk on Wednesday.

title: Zambia drop 4 NWSL stars, cite U.S. travel rules
content: The Zambia women's national team have removed their four U.S.-based players from the squad for the Yongchuan International Tournament in China due to concerns over U.S. travel measures, the Zambia FA said on Wednesday.

title: How one tryout sent Shavon Revel on his way from a warehouse job to the NFL's doorstep
content: After struggling at juco and working at Amazon, the ECU corner changed it all at a tryout camp on one hour's sleep.

title: Where will Aaron Rodgers sign? Here's everything we learned at the 2025 league meeting
content: Pittsburgh executives are feeling good about their chances with Rodgers, but could Minnesota still be in play?

title: League meeting: QB options, draft maneuvers, roster holes
content: Annual meetings wrapped up Tuesday, and more than 20 of our reporters on the ground had all the news.

title: Cade Cunningham isn't satisfied yet: 'I think I can be the best basketball player in the world'
content: The former No. 1 pick has led Detroit's resurgence, but he has loftier goals than just ending the Pistons' five-year playoff drought.

title: Far from the March Madness spotlight, college hoops grapples with a gambling problem
content: All eyes are on the Final Four, but college athletics officials are worried about suspicious bets on games featuring smaller schools.

title: Florida center Olivier Rioux enjoys Final Four experience from record-breaking vantage point
content: The Florida Gators' redshirt freshman is the world's tallest teenager, according to the Guinness Book of World Records.

title: Power schools will outsource enforcing NIL payments to athletes
content: Skeptics say cash to players for commercial endorsements often far exceeds the service's actual value.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal begin talks with Nico Williams
content: Arsenal are reportedly plotting a move for Spain starlet Nico Williams this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: PFL wild cards: Watch out for Antonio Carlos Jr., Aaron Jeffery and Adam Borics
content: From Kana Watanabe to Aaron Jeffery and Adam Borics, here's a list of the fighters who could pull off an unlikely championship run in PFL this year.

title: UFC Fight Night expert picks, best bets: How Lerone Murphy remains unbeaten
content: Who prevails in this week's UFC Fight Night and PFL First Round? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Mayer moves up, Price makes top-10 debut
content: The two best welterweights are just separated by one spot. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Waqf Bill Passed By Rajya Sabha With 128 Votes For, 95 Against
content: The Waqf bill, after a smooth passage through Lok Sabha, breezed through the Rajya Sabha 24 hours later, after yet another marathon debate.

title: How BJP Brought Chandrababu Naidu, Nitish Kumar On Board For Waqf Bill
content: The decision of secular parties like Chandrababu Naidu's Telugu Desam Party and Nitish Kumar's Janata Dal United to support the contentious Waqf Amendment Bill has raised eyebrows in political circles.

title: "Millions Deeply Hurt": 2 JDU Leaders Quit Over Party's Support To Waqf Bill
content: Two key Janata Dal (United) leaders resigned from the party headed by Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar over the party's support to the passing of the Waqf Amendment Bill.

title: Centre-J&K Government Bonhomie Over? Tension Over Officers' Transfer
content: The initial bonhomie between the Omar Abdullah government and the Centre in Jammu and Kashmir appears to be fizzling out.

title: 8 Killed After Inhaling Toxic Gas In 150-Year-Old Well In Madhya Pradesh
content: A routine well-cleaning activity turned into a disaster in Madhya Pradesh's Kondawat village when eight people died after inhaling toxic gas.

title: US Stocks Plunge After Tariff Move, S&P 500 Sees Biggest Decline Since 2020
content: US stocks plunged Thursday as traders reacted to Donald Trump's sweeping tariff announcement a day earlier, with the broad-based S&P 500 recording its biggest one-day decline since 2020.

title: Pilot Killed In Jaguar Crash Got Engaged Days Ago, Ensured Co-Pilot Ejected
content: In a remarkable act of bravery, Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav saved countless lives during the tragic crash of a Jaguar fighter jet in Jamnagar, Gujarat.

title: PM, Bangladesh's Yunus Sit Next To Each Other At Summit Dinner In Bangkok
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Muhammad Yunus, the Chief Advisor of the interim government in Bangladesh, sat side by side during the official dinner hosted by the Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.

title: Man Rapes Bihar Teen In Bengaluru As Another Restrains, Beats Up Brother
content: A 19-year-old woman from Bihar was sexually assaulted near KR Puram railway station in Bengaluru. Two of the alleged assailants have been arrested.

title: Video: Moment Car 'Exploded' In Iconic Amsterdam Square
content: A man set himself and his car on fire on Amsterdam's iconic Dam Square on Thursday, police said, in what they suspected was a possible attempt to take his own life.

title: She Ordered Pizza, Drinks, Then Died By Suicide. Family Blames Cousin
content: Preeti Kushwaha, 18, allegedly had a secret marriage with her distant cousin and took her life after the man cut off all ties.

title: He "Founded Hindu Nation", Then Attempted To Take Over Land In Bolivia
content: Nithyananda fled India in 2019, leaving behind a sprawling religious empire, after being accused of child abduction, sexual assault and abuse, and claimed to have founded the nation of 'Kailasa', calling it a "safe haven" for Hindus.

title: IPL 2025: V3 Of KKR Shines As Defending Champions Thrash SRH By 80 Runs
content: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Sunrisers Hyderabad Highlights, IPL 2025: The V3 (Venkatesh Iyer, Vaibhav Arora, and Varun Chakaravarthy) of Kolkata Knight Riders gave exemplary performances as the defending champions beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 80 runs

title: Opinion: Alliance Calling: AIADMK-BJP May Have Finally Learnt A Hard Lesson
content: An alliance between the AIADMK and the BJP isn't an easy thing to achieve, even with Annamalai finally taming his aggression. But it's not entirely impossible either.

title: "Operation Over, Patient Healing": Trump On US Economy After Tariff Move
content: President Donald Trump acknowledged the shock brought by his tariffs onslaught Thursday, but said the US economy would emerge "far stronger," even as world markets tumbled.

title: Explained: What Are Tariffs, Why Countries Use Them, Who Pays
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday imposed sweeping tariffs that target key economic partners, escalating global trade tensions.

title: Parliament passes Waqf Amendment Bill 2025
content: The Parliament of India approved the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 after intense debates, highlighting its aim to reform Waqf property management and address corruption. The Bill passed with majority support, despite opposition accusations of it being unconstitutional and biased against the Muslim minority. The Bill now awaits the President's assent to become law.

title: IPL 2025: Iyer, Arora lead KKR to dominating 80-run victory over SRH
content: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) triumphed over Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) by 80 runs in IPL 2025, powered by Venkatesh Iyer’s explosive 60 off 29 balls and Vaibhav Arora's 3-wicket haul. KKR set a formidable total of 200/6 and dismissed SRH for 120, showcasing strong teamwork and a dominant performance at Eden Gardens, Kolkata.

title: In counter to Yunus's remark, PM Modi says Northeast integral to Bimstec
content: PM Narendra Modi highlighted India's Northeast as crucial for the Bimstec region during the summit in Thailand. There's a planned bilateral meeting with Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus after recent remarks implying the Northeast states are landlocked. Additionally, India's investment in regional connectivity projects was emphasized.

title: After cash pile row, SC judges resolve to post assets, liabilities online
content: Supreme Court judges, led by CJI Sanjiv Khanna, have agreed to publicly disclose their assets and liabilities following the discovery of cash at a high court judge's residence. The practice, started in 2009 but discontinued after a few years, is set to resume.

title: Tyeb Mehta's bull run continues: 2nd priciest Indian painting at 61.8cr
content: Tyeb Mehta's 'Trussed Bull' sold for Rs 61.8 crore, marking it the second most expensive Indian painting at auction globally. The sale at Saffronart's 25th anniversary auction highlights a strong art market. Mehta's life and art were deeply influenced by historical events and personal experiences, with his powerful imagery reflecting societal struggles.

title: USCIS' 'plain and straight message' to H1-B, Green Card visa applicants: There are only two...
content: USCIS has updated its policy to recognize only two biological sexes, aligning with President Trump's 2025 executive order. This change affects all pending and future immigration benefit requests, determining sex based on the birth certificate issued at or closest to the time of birth.

title: 260 on London-Mumbai flight stranded in Turkiye since Wednesday
content: Over 260 passengers on a Virgin Atlantic flight from London to Mumbai have been stranded at Turkiye's Diyarbakır airport for the past 24 hours due to a medical emergency and technical glitch. Passengers reportedly lacked basic amenities or clear information on their departure time, while the airline worked to resolve the issues.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman revealed that in its early days, employees were expected to continue working from home after dinner with their families. Hoffman's stance signifies a demanding culture deemed essential for startup success and believes it drives significant financial rewards for those who embrace it.

title: Supreme Court quashes 'tainted' selection of 25,752 Bengal school staff
content: Supreme Court has affirmed Calcutta High Court's decision to cancel the 2016 recruitment of more than 25,700 teachers and non-teaching staff in West Bengal. The process was found to be tainted with manipulation and fraud. Non-tainted candidates won't have to refund salaries. They can apply to their previous government positions, though their disputed employment period won't be compensated.

title: Trump tariffs: Dow Jones drops 1,400 points, US market leads global sell-off
content: The US stock market saw a sharp decline as the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell by 1,400 points, or 3.3%, following President Trump’s new tariffs on imports. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite also dropped, reflecting a global market sell-off. Economists warn these tariffs could lower US economic growth and increase inflation, potentially leading to a recession.

title: 'Seniors said focus on govt job instead': India's fastest man Gurindervir
content: Gurindervir Singh's journey from a small village in Punjab to becoming India's fastest man is inspiring. Despite facing adversities like health issues and financial struggles, his determination led him to break national records. With his father's motivation and relentless training, he aims for more success while highlighting the financial challenges faced by Indian athletes.

title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy at Town Hall: The way to get ahead at Amazon is not to …
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy emphasized that at Amazon, building large teams is not the path to advancement. Instead, the company rewards those who achieve more with fewer resources, highlighting customer impact and meritocracy. Jassy encouraged employees to act like owners, stay agile, and remain competitive while reducing bureaucracy and management layers.

title: Sanjeev Sanyal sacked as GIPE chancellor, fresh row breaks out
content: The governance dispute at Gokhale Institute of Politics and Economics has intensified after trustees replaced economist Sanjeev Sanyal with ex-judge SC Dharmadhikari as chancellor. Interim VC Shankar Das challenged the decision, citing UGC regulations, while the Servants of India Society accused Sanyal of inaction over the institution's declining credentials, prompting demands for a new chancellor.

title: Wall Street crash: Nearly $2tn wiped as Trump's tariffs shake US markets
content: Approximately $1.7 trillion was wiped from the US' S&P 500 Index as markets opened due to fears of President Trump's tariffs potentially triggering a recession. Key companies like Apple, Nike, and Walmart, with overseas manufacturing, recorded major declines.

title: J&K Police identifies 200 social media handles involved in radicalisation
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police has identified 200 social media handles involved in spreading radicalisation and glorifying terrorism. Efforts by the cyber cell over the past three months have led to the identification of these handles, with 100 operating from outside the country. Multiple FIRs have been filed, and some individuals influenced by this content have been de-radicalised.

title: PM Modi, Yunus sit together at BIMSTEC dinner table, likely to meet tomorrow
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Bangladesh chief adviser Muhammad Yunus were seen together at the BIMSTEC dinner table amidst worsening India-Bangladesh relations. The tension arose from Yunus' remarks about India's Northeast during his China visit, which Indian politicians criticized as provocative.

title: In a first, Omar calls meet to discuss LG’s decision
content: J&K CM Omar Abdullah has convened a meeting to address tensions arising from LG Manoj Sinha's recent transfer of 48 JKAS officers. The NC alleges this undermines the democratic process. The issue will likely be discussed during Union home minister Amit Shah’s upcoming visit to J&K.

title: 'Abhi mereko koi karne ki jarurat nahi hai': Rohit Sharma's comment goes viral
content: Mumbai Indians’ Rohit Sharma and Lucknow Super Giants’ Rishabh Pant shared a warm hug before their IPL 2025 match. The video went viral, showing their camaraderie. Both teams have had an inconsistent start this season. MI, led by Hardik Pandya, face challenges, while LSG rely on Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh for good performance.

title: Apple stock leads Tech decline as Trump’s tariff triggers market panic
content: Technology stocks tumbled as President Trump's new tariff policies incited market panic, with Apple leading the sharp decline at nearly 9%. The Nasdaq Composite fell over 5%, its worst performance in five years. Trump imposed tariffs on imports, including a 34% tax on China, escalating fears of a global trade war.

title: WWE’s Paul Heyman dismisses John Cena in favor of Roman Reigns and CM Punk
content: Paul Heyman has stirred the wrestling world by ranking Roman Reigns as the number one wrestler, followed by CM Punk. He downplayed John Cena’s skills and strength, stating CM Punk is above him, but not above Roman Reigns. This ranking adds excitement to the upcoming WrestleMania 41, where these WWE superstars will battle.

title: Venkatesh Iyer’s love affair with SRH continues, joins an elite list
content: Venkatesh Iyer's blistering 60 off 29 balls helped Kolkata Knight Riders set a competitive total of 200/6 against Sunrisers Hyderabad in their IPL 2025 clash. This was Iyer’s third successive fifty against SRH. Contributions from Rahane, Raghuvanshi, and Singh also bolstered KKR's score, emphasising the significance of domestic cricket in player development.

title: How Nithyananda's Kailasa 'land trafficked' Bolivia's indigenous people
content: The United States of Kailasa, led by fugitive Swami Nithyananda, claims to be a sovereign Hindu nation with its own currency and passports. However, 20 of its followers were arrested in Bolivia for illegal land agreements. Nithyananda, accused of serious crimes in India, argues these are conspiracies against him.

title: White House ousts NSC staffers after Trump's meeting with Laura Loomer
content: The White House has fired three National Security Council staffers following a meeting between President Trump and far-right activist Laura Loomer. Loomer questioned the loyalty of NSC members, prompting the dismissals. The three officials ousted are Brian Walsh, Thomas Boodry, and David Feith. An NSC spokesperson declined to comment on personnel matters.

title: India, China and the Penguin: Winners and losers of Trump's tariff war
content: US President Donald Trump announced a 10% baseline tariff on all imports starting April 5. Additional tariffs on specific countries will begin on April 9. These tariffs target nations with unfair trade practices. India, the UK, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, China, the EU, Japan, and Southeast Asian nations are affected. This policy could reshape global trade dynamics.

title: Opinion: Will India Inc outshine US’s ‘Liberation’?
content: The most viable option for India at this stage would be to conclude India-US trade agreement discussions and reach a consensus which would help both countries to align for respective economic growth.

title: Ax-4 mission will see around 60 experiments, including 7 led by Isro
content: India’s Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will pilot the Axiom-4 mission to the ISS, involving around 60 scientific studies, with seven from India. The mission will focus on microgravity research, impacting biological processes and strategies for long-term space missions. It will include comprehensive research from nations like the US, Poland, Hungary, and others, contributing to global scientific progress.

title: Govt officer accused of exceeding power can’t be prosecuted without prior sanction: SC
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that public servants who exceed their official powers are still protected from prosecution under Section 170 of the Police Act, provided there is a reasonable connection between their actions and their official duties. The safeguard requires prior government sanction before any legal proceedings can be initiated.

title: 'Self-goal': Raghuram Rajan uses football analogy for Trump's tariffs
content: Former RBI governor Raghuram Rajan criticised the Trump administration’s new reciprocal tariffs, calling them a 'self-goal' that will harm the US economy in the short term. Rajan notes that the impact on India will be relatively smaller and suggests India reduce domestic tariffs to boost trade and competitiveness despite the global trend towards protectionism.

title: 'Khudko The Lord bol raha hai': Watch Rohit's banter with Shardul Thakur
content: Rohit Sharma's playful interaction with Shardul Thakur and Zaheer Khan set a lighthearted tone before the IPL 2025 match between Lucknow Super Giants and Mumbai Indians. Despite recent struggles, both teams aim for a crucial win. MI, led by Hardik Pandya, face challenges with batting consistency, while LSG rely on Nicholas Pooran's explosive form.

title: 'He got engaged days ago': Father of IAF pilot who died in Gujarat crash
content: Indian Air Force pilot Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav tragically died in a Jaguar fighter jet crash in Jamnagar, Gujarat. He was a brilliant student, engaged to be married, and from a family with a strong military background. The crash occurred during a night mission due to technical malfunction.

title: Did Anthony Edwards offer $1M for 18 yrs of child support? Ayesha breaks silence
content: Minnesota Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards was rumored to have prepaid 18 years of child support, but his ex, Ayesha Howard, clarified that no such arrangement exists. Howard debunked this misinformation, expressing frustration over the spread of falsehoods. Additionally, Edwards faced previous allegations from another woman about pressuring her to terminate a pregnancy.

title: 3-time Stanley Cup Champion Sidney Crosby owns stake in Swiss watchmaking company
content: Sidney Crosby, Pittsburgh Penguins legend, has joined Swiss watchmaking company NORQAIN as a shareholder and brand ambassador. Founded in 2018, NORQAIN has links to both Breitling and NHL players. Crosby expressed his excitement about collaborating with NORQAIN, and co-founder Mark Streit considers it a perfect match due to their shared values and work ethic.

title: 'It's time govt develop a spine': Oppn rips into PM Modi over US tariff
content: Opposition leaders criticized Prime Minister Modi over the US's 27 percent tariff on Indian goods. Rahul Gandhi and other MPs warned of severe impacts on industries like automobiles and pharmaceuticals. They urged the government to respond strongly, highlighting the economic risks and questioning Modi's handling of US relations.

title: Exclusive - Eisha Singh reacts to dealing with trolls after Bigg Boss 18
content: Television stars Eisha Singh and Avinash Mishra made a comeback with their new song Kala Sha Kala. Eisha addressed the trolling she faced post Bigg Boss 18, emphasizing her positivity and self-improvement. Avinash supported her, noting that all contestants experience both criticism and support.

title: 'At home, you should get what you want': Rahane amid Eden pitch controversy
content: Ajinkya Rahane of Kolkata Knight Riders expressed satisfaction with the Eden Gardens pitch ahead of their IPL 2025 match against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Rahane's comment came amidst recent controversy over the pitch conditions. Sunrisers Hyderabad won the toss and opted to bowl first, aiming to overturn last season's results where KKR dominated. High stakes are expected in this match.

title: 'Against Indian Muslims': JD(U) leader resigns over party's stand on Waqf Bill
content: Senior JD(U) leader Mohammed Qasim Ansari resigns, citing the party's support for the Waqf Amendment Bill 2024. Accusing JD(U) of betraying secular principles and violating constitutional rights, he expresses regret over his long association with the party.

title: Why is Russia missing from Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs list?
content: President Donald Trump announced broad tariffs affecting most nations, excluding Russia, citing existing sanctions that limit trade. Despite seeking enhanced trade relations with Russia, US trade figures with Russia have significantly declined, and experts question Trump's strategy given the larger commercial opportunities with Canada, Mexico, and Europe.

title: Bharuch horror: Friend chops man into 9 pieces, dresses up as woman to dispose parts
content: The Bharuch police solved a gruesome murder where Shailendra Chauhan chopped his friend Sachin into nine pieces over private photos and a loan dispute. Shailendra, disguising himself as a woman, disposed of the body parts at various locations, which initially baffled investigators. He was eventually caught in Bijnor.

title: 'No party whip': BJD tells MPs to 'exercise conscience' on Waqf Bill
content: Biju Janata Dal emphasizes the importance of justice, harmony, and community rights regarding the Waqf Amendment Bill in Rajya Sabha. The party did not issue a whip, encouraging its members to vote according to their conscience despite announcing opposition to the bill.

title: Why Trump excluded India's pharma sector from reciprocal tariffs
content: The US has exempted Indian pharmaceuticals from tariffs amidst President Trump’s broad tariff imposition, recognizing their crucial role in global healthcare. This move reinforces India’s position as a key provider of affordable generic medicines. Leaders highlight the strategic importance of the bilateral trade relationship, with the exemption offering India a chance to enhance its pharmaceutical sector.

title: 'Will bring amendment to nullify Waqf Bill': Mamata Banerjee
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee has rejected the Waqf Amendment Bill passed by the Lok Sabha, expressing determination to nullify it once the BJP is ousted. During a presser, she accused the BJP of attempting to divide the country with the bill, which passed with 288 votes in favor and 232 against.

title: Meerut murder: Muskan breaks down on seeing lover in video call
content: A Meerut court extended the judicial custody of Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla for another 14 days in connection with the murder of Muskan's husband, Saurabh Rajput. They appeared via video conferencing and were kept in separate barracks. Muskan and Sahil have admitted to the gruesome crime.

title: 2025 rankings: Profiles for the top 30 TEs
content: the 2025 fantasy football rookie rankings do not include rookies . he has profiled the top 80 skill position players in his rookie rankings . the 22-year-old is already an elite player and the figures to benefit fro the draft .

title: Profiles for the top 55 WRs
content: Mike Clay reveals his fantasy football rookie rankings at each key offensive position . the rankings do not include rookies, since we are unsure of their landing spot . he has finished in the top 12 in fantasy PPG in all four of his seasons .

title: Harry Kane is on a mission to finally end his long personal trophy drought
content: despite winning trophies and featuring in five finals, Harry Kane has never won a major club trophy . the 33-time german league champion has never tasted victory in a competition . he says he is a man on a mission to win silverware of note . his first year with Bayern Munich ended trophy-less, an unusual feat .

title: 'Op is over, the patient lived': Trump after levying reciprocal tariffs
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world . read more Katrina to Sonam: Dhoti-style ethnic designs donned by Bollywood's style divas 9 most iconic quotes from books and authors .

title: Power Rankings: Who are the top teams one week into the season?
content: the Dodgers and Padres are undefeated, while a team with lofty expectations in the Braves are winless to start the season . we've seen both great individual performances -- Aaron Judge ' walk-off three-run blast' and not so great ones -- Rafael Devers' historic strikeout streak .

title: ‘Fugitive’ terrorists spotted in Udhampur, search launched

title: 'We want to turn Pakistan into a Hindu Rashtra': BJP's Nitesh Rane
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Think like an expert: Stephania Bell breaks down how to look at baseball injuries
content: Stephania Bell and Tristan H. Cockcroft share insights on injuries . the 2025 fantasy baseball season is here! join or start a brand-new tradition . if you're a fantasy baseball manager or just a fan of a player or team, here's how to think about injury .

title: Inside one prospect's 'storybook' journey from Egypt to the NFL draft
content: AHMED HASSANEIN 'S JOURNEY to the doorstep of the NFL began on a balcony seven years ago in Cairo . his sisters, brother and nephew, Gigi and Aziza Ibrahim, told Hassanein's older brother, Cory Besch, about his life over the past decade after moving from California at age 6 . he had forgotten how to speak English, had behavioral issues that caused him to be expelled from school .

title: 'Everybody has to run their own race': Will Thibs' strategy doom the minutes-heavy Knicks?
content: the Minnesota Timberwolves set a modern NBA record by blowing 22 double-digit leads . coach and team president Tom Thibodeau was crystal clear in diagnosing the issue . despite a slew of teams leaning into the league's load-management strategy, the Wolves did the opposite .

title: Ranking the 15 best players: From Bueckers and Betts to Paopao and Strong
content: the top 15 players in women's college basketball will compete in the final four . "nBA Today" has ranked the top players in men's basketball throughout the season . it's time to see the very best on the biggest stage . the WNBA draft pick is in her fourth final Four .

title: Scott leads Cardinals? More Devers woes? Don't be surprised
content: the 2025 fantasy baseball season is here! get the gang back together, or start a brand new tradition . if a rookie steals bundles of bases, don't be surprised... if Victor Scott becomes the best fantasy hitter .

title: Parliament clears Waqf Amendment Bill
content: Rajya Sabha saw over 14-hour debate ending past 2:30 am on Friday morning, with 128 members voting in favour and 95 against it.

title: Communist Party of China for strengthening ties between India and China
content: “The CPC and the CPI(M) have long maintained friendly exchanges, which played a significant role for facilitating mutual understanding and practical cooperation between our two sides,” says International Department, Central Committee, CPC

title:
Munambam lens on Waqf Bill
passage roils Kerala politics
content: BJP’s attempt to link the legislation to the land dispute in the locality in Kochi, an emotive issue for the Christian community in the State, puts parties on either side of the political aisle in a quandary in the run-up to the Assembly election next year

title: Kerala, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal have received no funds under Samagra Shiksha for FY2024-25
content: A Parliamentary Standing Committee reported that withholding funds was “severely impacting teachers’ salaries, RTE reimbursements, and transportation for students in remote areas” in affected States.

title: Non-Muslims will not have majority in Central Waqf Council: Kiren Rijiju
content: The Union Minister rejects the Opposition’s allegations that the Waqf (amendment) Bill is aimed at grabbing Muslim’s land or their rights

title: SCARF, SAMVAD to study behaviour of young road traffic offenders at the instance of Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh records his appreciation for both the organisations and asks State Public Prosecutor to apprise him of the developments on June 9, 2025

title: Never since Independence has there been such a serious attack on Indian federalism, says Prakash Karat
content: In every aspect of Centre-State relations, be it political or economic or fiscal, the Union government has been systematically undermining the federal principles, he charges at CPI(M)‘s 24th party congress in Madurai

title: Starbucks opens its maiden drive-thru cafe in South India in Bengaluru
content: ‘With 50 cafes in the City, Starbucks continue to remain very bullish on Bengaluru and its growing cafe culture’, says Sushant Dash, CEO, TATA Starbucks

title: Munambam land row echoes in Rajya Sabha
content: BJP Ministers highlight the land row between the residents of Munambam and the Kerala Waqf Board to justify the need for Waqf (amendment) Bill

title: BJP trying to sow seeds of conflict through Waqf bill, urge govt to withdraw it, says Kharge
content: Mr. Kharge also alleged that ever since the BJP-led NDA government came to power, ₹3,574 crore out of a total of ₹18,274 crore allocated for minorities was returned as the amount remained unspent.

title: Tanks battle polluted groundwater
content: In Haryana, groundwater pollution has led people to build underground tanks that are fed by expensive water tank services whose costs escalate in summer. Ashok Kumar talks to residents to understand the extent of the problem, and to government officials, who claim that piped water supply has solved the issue

title: Laurus Labs to invest ₹5,000 crore in A.P
content: Laurus Labs to invest ₹5,000 crore in a bulk drugs unit in Anakapalli, creating 7,500 jobs; CM Chandrababu Naidu assures govt support

title: Eight people enter well to clean it, die after inhaling toxic gas in M.P.’s Khandwa
content: “First three people went into the well and started cleaning. As they cleared some silt, a gas started leaking from it resulting in the men fainting. Two more men went in to check on them but they also fainted and collapsed,” said police

title: Like Ladakh, UT without legislature will not serve the aspiration of people : BJP MLA on Gorkhaland talks
content: MHA meets Gorkha delegation for “tripartite” talks in the absence of representation from West Bengal government.

title: Construction work of RGUHS new campus at Ramanagara to be completed by December-end
content: 30% of the work of the new campus has already been completed and the remaining work is on in full swing: Dr. Sharan Prakash Patil

title: RSS tribal wing hails government for protecting tribal land in Waqf Bill
content: Thanking the government for safeguarding the tribal land, the VKS said that the organisation has presented its views before the Joint Parliamentary Committee

title: A.P farmers oppose Centre’s three new policies
content: Andhra Pradesh Rythu Sangham opposes Centre’s new farming policies, calling them anti-farmer and a rebranded version of revoked black laws

title: MP Y.V. Subba Reddy strongly opposes Wakf Bill in Rajya Sabha
content: The Bill goes against Articles 13, 14, 25, and 26 of the Indian Constitution, in which the rights to equality, religious freedom, and the management of religious institutions are enshrined

title: Opposed Waqf Bill as BJP plans to grab land: Uddhav Thackeray
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde hits back, calling the Shiv Sena (UBT)‘s stand against the Bill ‘biggest crime’

title: India holds fire as Trump slaps tariffs
content: Global 10% baseline tariff comes into effect on April 5, higher tariffs from April 9; Commerce Ministry says it is assessing impact, including “opportunities”, as tariffs on India lower than rival exporters; China, EU threaten reprisal

title: A.P. Congress leaders meet Governor, seek redressal of critical issues
content: Congress leaders seeking action on the Waqf Bill, caste census, local body reservations, and DSC notification

title: Kashmir’s Pulwama takes a leap to meet India’s over 20 lakh annual tulip bulbs demand
content: Spread over 60 hectares at an altitude of 5400 feet, Pulwama’s Bonera station is emerging as the launching pad of the ambitious project that also aims to see new tulip blooming destinations adding to India’s tourism map in the future

title: Senior JD(U) leader Mohammad Kasim Ansari resigns, quits party over its stand on Waqf Bill
content: This Bill violates many fundamental rights of the Constitution, and through this, Indian Muslims are being humiliated and disgraced, he says in resignation letter to party chief Nitish Kumar

title: Explained: Why TN Assembly wants Katchatheevu retrieved?
content: M.K. Stalin has called upon the Union Government to immediately review the Indo-Sri Lankan agreement of 1974 and take steps to retrieve Katchatheevu.

title: A.P. Congress chief Sharmila slams CM Naidu for supporting Wakf Bill
content: APCC chief Y. S. Sharmila criticises CM Chandrababu Naidu for backing the Waqf Bill, alleges cover-up in Viveka murder case, and alleges hand of BJP in pastor’s death

title: Waqf bill: BJP trying to snatch rights of Muslims, says Brinda Karat
content: The timing of the Bill’s introduction and haste to pass it show it is a planned attack by the BJP-RSS combine, she says on the sidelines of the 24th party congress in Madurai

title: Future uncertain for Bengal’s ‘sacked’ teachers as Supreme Court confirms cancellation of over 23,000 appointments
content: Teachers recruited in 2016 gathered at Kolkata’s Shahid Minar to watch the Supreme Court proceedings today, breaking down into frantic tears after news broke of the invalidation of their appointments

title: Kancha Gachibowli Land | Telangana Govt to constitute Committee for way forward
content: The committee with group of Ministers will consult with Hyderabad Central University executive committee, Civil society groups, students delegation and all the stakeholders

title: Difficult to heal pain suffered due to unjust demolition, says Allahabad scholar
content: Former professor Ali Ahmed Fatmi has said that he respects the Supreme Court’s compensation for his home but laments the loss of his home and wife, who died soon after the demolition

title: Students of Nellore-based school bag top prizes at NSS Space Settlement contest
content: Mannuru Mahikshith Reddy and Mohammad Ayman of Ithaka International School won the World second and third prize for their projects

title: Tejashwi Yadav born with a silver spoon: BJP Bihar chief Dilip Jaiswal
content: As part of BJP’s Foundation Day programmes, Jaiswal says a conference of active members will be organised in all 243 Assembly constituencies in which more than 1.57 lakh persons will participate

title: Rijiju attacks senior member for creating confusion, not staying back to listen to reply on debate
content: Kiren Rijiju was referring to the comments made by independent MP Kapil Sibal who raised to oppose the bill

title: A.P. Chief Minister urged to release funds for modernisation of Thotapalli canals
content: Jana Sena leaders request CM Naidu to release funds for Thotapalli canal upgrades to improve irrigation for 35,000 acres in Etcherla

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin writes to PM Modi on Katchatheevu retrieval
content: CM Stalin urges PM Modi to take immediate steps to review the Indo-Sri Lankan agreement so that the island is retrieved and traditional fishing rights of Indian fishermen are permanently protected

title: Boeing aircraft delays, supply chain issues may worsen
content: Local suppliers though hope that with India imposing minimal import duty, the retaliatory tariff from the U.S. may not hit the aviation industry

title: HC notices to Telangana govt departments over land abutting University of Hyderabad
content: The Bench instructed top officials of different wings of the governments to respond to the notices by filing their respective counter affidavits by Monday

title: Chennai and Kamarajar ports cross 100 million tonnes of cargo handling
content: They record a combined operating income of ₹2,200 crore; chairman says infrastructure is being continuously upgraded

title: BBMP to ramp up dengue control measures as cases rise in Bengaluru
content: BBMP revealed that 15,282 dengue cases been reported in Bengaluru in 2024, compared to 11,136 cases in 2023 and 2,335 cases in 2022. From January to March 31 this year, 329 cases have been recorded

title: Hope still alive for Thripunithura bypass project
content: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways decides to entrust a board member of NHAI with the task of studying the feasibility of the corridor

title: Ordinance on gig workers’ social security likely to be introduced by Karnataka, following discussion with Rahul Gandhi
content: As many as six changes were made to the proposed legislation to ‘strike a balance’, which would likely be introduced as Ordinance next week

title: Kerala Minister, officials visit natural farming fields in NTR, Guntur districts
content: Delegation commends Andhra Pradesh’s efforts in promoting climate-resilient and farmer-friendly agricultural practices

title: BRS opposes Waqf Bill; YSRCP, BJD leave it to their Rajya Sabha members to decide their vote
content: All the parties have questioned inclusion of non-Muslims in the Waqf Boards and interference by the government in administering the Waqf properties

title: Jagan only pretends to be concerned for welfare of Muslims, alleges MLA Naseer Ahmed
content: Why YSRCP did not propose any changes to draft Wakf Amendment Bill if Mr. Jagan is apprehensive of its consequences to minority community, the legislator asks

title: Srikakulam police arrest two thieves, recover ₹40.02 lakh gold ornaments
content: Both the accused had separate criminal histories and were involved in multiple thefts across North Andhra

title: ‘Tiger Triumph’ sees a rise in domain complexities, says Rear Admiral Greg Newkirk of U.S. Navy
content: The exercise has been designed to see that all the services of the armed forces of both the nations can operate seamlessly under a combined structure of the joint task force, he says

title: K.C. Unniyanujan Raja passes away
content: The interests of the head of the erstwhile Zamorin family ranged from traditional mathematics to advanced computing, leading him to travel extensively and master technologies

title: Kin make an appeal not to politicise pastor Praveen’s death
content: We have faith in the probe ordered by the A.P. government, we urge fellow community members to refrain from self-investigation and to not disturb communal harmony, urge his wife Jessica and brother Kiran

title: Railway users demand additional stop, more trains and extra ticket counters at DRUCC meeting in Tiruchi
content: Passengers’ association in Papanasam wanted the Tambaram-Nagercoil Antyodaya Express to stop for one minute and Vande Bharat between Bengaluru and Thanjavur

title: Jala Harati Corporation to take up Godavari-Banakacharla Link Project in Andhra Pradesh
content: The special purpose vehicle completely owned by the government will take up the water project that is estimated to cost ₹80,000 crore and is aimed at transforming Rayalaseema into a prosperous region; Cabinet approves proposal to extend government guarantee for ₹710-crore loan taken by AP Power Finance Corporation Limited from HUDCO

title: Visit families of all those killed in faction violence, not just Lingamaiah’s, Paritala Sunitha tells Jagan
content: ‘Several families involved in faction violence have shunned violence, and factionalism has now become a thing of the past. The Thopudarthi family, however, is instigating others against us. They are trying to incite faction violence again in this region after losing power’

title: Third round of talks to settle ASHAs’  stir remain inconclusive
content: While Health Minister Veena George says the discussions were ‘constructive”, ASHAs’ representatives say the government had no new solutions to offer to resolve the stalemate

title: Telangana SIT chairs first meeting on online betting cases
content: The five-member SIT has been tasked with conducting a time-bound investigation into online betting cases assigned to it

title: Lokesh launches distribution of permanent house site title documents to the poor
content: In the first phase, the HRD Minister plans to distribute 3,000 title documents in Mangalagiri constituency
